title: Account Executive
description:
Job Title: Account Executive
At Wurthy, we're leading a revolution in payment management, offering flexible solutions that benefit both our clients and their customers. With our innovative "Buy Now, Pay Later" options, we're committed to increasing revenue, eliminating credit card fees, and maximizing profit margins for businesses across various industries. Join us in making payments effortless, while transforming the financial landscape for businesses everywhere.
The Role:Launching a new product and bringing a new type of solution to market takes foresight and the ability to understand what this product could become. We are excited to expand our sales team and bring on Account Executives to support our market entry and revenue scaling efforts. In this outbound focused role, you will be responsible for finding, nurturing and qualifying new prospects from a defined market of small businesses across industries including healthcare, retail & e-commerce, and continuing education, and services. 
As the first line of communication with prospects, ideal Account Executives have a strong understanding of sales processes, excelling at researching leads, starting new relationships, and building confidence for merchants to conduct business via the Wurthy platform. Our ideal candidate is someone who loves to connect with stakeholders, exhibits outstanding judgment, maturity, confidence, and professionalism, and thrives in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment within a close-knit team. If you’re passionate about startups, resilient, and ready for a fast-paced career in sales, then we want you to join our team.
Core Responsibilities:Primarily outbound, net-new business generation focused on bringing high-value merchants onto the Wurthy platform, and enabling them to transact as quickly and efficiently as possibleStrategically researching/identifying potential client contacts, generating leads, and uncovering high-value opportunitiesDriving business through outbound phone calls, preparing and sending strategic emails to prospective clients specific to their business needs, and educating the value of the Wurthy platformSuccessfully diagnosing the client’s key business needs to ensure a high quality of interaction in the first sales meetingOvercome objections from prospective customers, turning those objections into value propositionsWork with our Merchant Success team to expand relationships with merchants, enabling them to continue to find value in working with Wurthy
How you’ll add value: Established as a top performer at most recent/current employer, ideally selling FinTech or SaaSHave 1+ years of sales experience, with direct experience in a predominantly outbound capacityGoal and action orientation, with a sense of urgency, drive, and commitment to routinely exceed monthly activity & close metrics (new logos & transaction volume/$)Poise, confidence, and maturity to interact with senior client levelsThrive in a consultative and strategic sales role. A solutions-oriented critical thinker who is not afraid to failWill be ambitious, able to build trust, motivated, think outside the box – “figure-it-out-ability"Have excellent verbal and written communication skills, is coachable, wants to succeed, and has been effective in utilizing CRM and other engagement tools (we use Hubspot!)
Benefits:As an early-stage startup entering the market, we understand the vision it takes to join us, which comes with a degree of risk. While we're still shaping our benefits program, early team members have the unparalleled opportunity to shape the future of our organization and reap the rewards of our growth.
Vacation: Enjoy unlimited vacation time, as we believe in the importance of rest and rejuvenation to bring your best self to work.Equity: We offer equity packages to ensure that your success and the success you drive for the company directly benefit you.Remote Work: Embrace the flexibility of working from anywhere within the USA.

title: Manufacturing Supervisor, Leads
description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 114,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.

A healthy heart is essential to good health. That's why we're committed to advancing treatments for people with cardiovascular disease. As a global leader in Cardiac Rhythm Technologies, our breakthrough medical technologies help restore people's health so they can get back to living their best lives, faster. We focus on innovative technologies that can improve the way doctors treat people with heart arrhythmias, or irregular heartbeats.

Our location in Sylmar, CA, currently has an opportunity for a Manufacturing Supervisor, Leads is responsible for driving the process of continuous improvement and lean principles. They are responsible for their shifts' performance with respect to safety, quality, on-time delivery and cost.

This role is open for Mon-Fri-6:00am-2:30pm

What You’ll Do

Maintain high level of visibility with production staff. Use hands-on approach to communicate daily and involve production staff in problem solving.Develop a high performance work team with high levels of worker morale, satisfaction, and performance.Create and maintain a respectful work environment by listening, seeking facts to support decisions, managing one's own reactions, and addressing unacceptable behavior.Help production staff succeed through performance management. Provide coaching and performance communication to support development.Review general status of production schedules to identify and resolve problems.Ensure the desired product quality levels are achieved through use of standard work and training to those standards, training in operation and inspection techniques, and use of tools/data.Support and implement new, customer-focused processes in accordance with lean principles and practices. Provide training and coaching to improve standard work, work center organization (5S), and housekeeping. Actively provide change leadership as required.Support and foster an environment of continuous improvement by encouraging production staff to challenge existing processes and implement solutions that enhance the overall effectiveness of the operation.Support production staff in understanding company policies and practices.Maintain time and production records.Take notice of process related problems and support production staff in taking corrective action to improve the overall performance of the team.Communicate with and listen to production staff on a daily basis regarding work team performance, strategic initiatives, policy changes, safety, quality, etc.Communicate with other supervisors and appropriate personnel regarding equipment, safety, work center schedules, company policies and practices, performance improvement plans, etc.Hires and retains a diverse, highly qualified staff and provides ongoing performance feedback. Maintains a safe and professional work environment.Support all Company initiatives as identified by management and in support of Quality Management Systems (QMS), Environmental Management Systems (EMS), and other regulatory requirementsComplies with U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, other regulatory requirements, Company policies, operating procedures, processes, and task assignments. Maintains positive and cooperative communications and collaboration with all levels of employees, customers, contractors, and vendors.

Education And Experience You’ll Bring

Associates Degree Preferred OR an equivalent combination of education and work experienceBachelors Degree Preferred OR an equivalent combination of education and work experienceMinimum 3 years Previous experience in manufacturing operations with demonstrated ability to acquire and apply manufacturing principals is preferred. Experience working in a broader enterprise/cross division business unit model preferred. Ability to work in a highly matrixed and geographically diverse business environment. Strong leadership skills, including the ability to set goals and provide positive and constructive feedback respectfully to build positive relationships and improve business results. Ability to work effectively within a team in a fast-paced changing environment. Strong verbal and written communications with ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels in the organization. Multi-tasks, prioritizes and meets deadlines in timely manner. Strong organizational, planning, and follow-up skills and ability to hold others accountable.Ability to travel approximately 5% (If required)

What We Offer

At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer:

Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistanceFinancial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plansHealth care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programsPaid time off401(k) retirement savings with a generous company matchThe stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities

Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully: www.abbottbenefits.com

Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.

Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

The base pay for this position is $65,900.00 – $131,900.00. In specific locations, the pay range may vary from the range posted.

title: Account Representative, Pre-Award
description:
Job Description

BASIC FUNCTIONS

The Account Representative, Pre-Award shall work with customers and/or vendors to obtain pricing and bid on government opportunities. This individual has the responsibility and authority to carry out assigned tasks.

SPECIFIC DUTIES

 Obtain pricing/quotations.  Understand all bid elements and apply appropriate mark-up to ensure company profitability.  Identify opportunities for negotiation.  Familiarity with FAR/DFARs/DLADS appearing in the master solicitation and most commonly appearing in DLA solicitations.  Analyze win/ loss information.  Review losses and take appropriate action.  Process and manage orders from customer request to hand-off to post-award team.  Verify pricing for expired quotes.  Build and maintain strong working relationships with suppliers and customers.  Impeccable customer service.  Field sales phone calls.  Solid understanding of value-add proposition.  Ability to understand and follow protocols.  Has authority to submit bids and commit company to future sale of goods and services up to $100K. 

Standard Requirements

Comply with all requirements of International Standard ISO9001 and ISO27001, NIST 800-171, CMMC – Cyber Security and Informational Data Security Requirements. Aerospace Management System Standards AS9100, AS9120, IDEA-QMS-9090, ASA-100 and supporting construct standards AS6081, IDEA-STD-1010, AC7402-CAAP, CCAP-101, FAA AC00-56, ANSI/ESD S20.20. All employees shall commit and comply with the requirements of AS5553 for Counterfeit Electrical, Electronic and Electromechanical (EEE) Parts – Avoidance, Detection, Mitigation and Disposition practices.

Education / Experience / Competency

 Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite: Word & Excel, Internet and Microsoft Outlook.  Bachelor’s Degree or 5+ years of working experience in military logistics or similar type of environment.  Consistent, extreme attention to detail.  Strong written & verbal communication skills.  Strong math, reading, analytical, critical-thinking and computer skills.  Ability to prioritize tasks and stay organized.  Ability to meet strict deadlines.  Independent problem solver. 

Company Description

title: Production Lead
description:
Job Description

Purpose:

The Production Lead is responsible for establishing a safe work environment and ensuring delivery of quality products as outline in the production schedule.

Essential Job Duties:

Setup and startup of production lines each dayInitiates plans to motivate workers to achieve goalsWilling to jump in and help the team members that they superviseEffectively communicate with production employees the specific tasks and goals for the dayTrain and monitor production line workers and track their efficienciesCoordinate with receiving department to ensure that raw product is available at the front of line when neededResponsible for the daily production documentationAll other tasked assigned by management. 

Essential Physical Demands:

Frequently stands, lifts, walks, reaches, stoops, bends over, handles product, smells, listens, speaks and sees to perform the essential job duties.

Reasoning Ability:

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

Education and/or experience:

High School Diploma, (GED) or 2 years’ lead experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Knowledge of production environment and troubleshoot problems effectively. Bilingual – Spanish preferred

Working Conditions

Report to work at assigned time. Pm shift starts around 2pm ending time will vary based upon production requirements for the day. Flexibility in work hours and days is crucial. The temperatures range from 30 to 110 degrees in rooms. There is exposure to equipment and machinery that are considered to be hazardous. Potential electrical, mechanical, chemical, and heat hazards are also present. The level of noise is high and constant. Floors are damp and slick. 

Personal Protective Equipment

Hard hats, ear plugs or muffs, frocks, non-porous steel toed boots, hair nets, must be worn at all times within the plant. Frocks are to remain in productions areas unless they are to be replaced when soiled. Latex gloves must be worn when handling product or contacting sanitary surfaces

title: ASSEMBLY CELL OPERATOR
description:
Job Description

Job Title: Assembly Cell Operator

Department: Production

Reports To: Production Supervisor

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

Summary

Total responsibility for the safe, quality, and efficient operation of a press and banding tool.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned by Team Leader or Supervisor. Must maintain a regular, reliable, consistent and punctual attendance in accordance with assigned schedule and time off policies.

Work with CoBot assembly cell to ensure a consistent pace and meet production rates. Load and unload Great Products half tubes for full tube assembly. As part of assembly process, make sure CoBot is stocked with caulk at all times. Once caulk process is complete, install rivets into tube assembly using provided rivet gun. Ensure completed assemblies and work cell are free from extra caulk. Loaded completed assemblies on pallets in very precise manner, utilizing engineered guidance for stacking. Make tags (Router/WIP – Inventory). Perform basic operations at work cell. Pack and secure parts in pack station using our banding tools. Procure batches as needed and follow priority schedule. Assemble packaging material as necessary. Set weight scales for parts counting as needed. Inspect and perform quality checks of parts being packed, as necessary. Mop and clean work area as needed. Maintains work area in a clean and safe condition, following 5S standards. Understanding and working knowledge of all job-related Quality Objectives, Quality System Policies, Procedures, and Instructions. 

IMPACT ON CUSTOMER QUALITY Failure to perform these activities will likely result in dissatisfaction to the internal/external customer.

Follow established instructions and quality standards. Responsible for the safety of self, team and product from damage and/or injury. Proper set up of dies following current standardized set-up instructions. Insures correct packaging and piece-counts on skids/containers. Proper first/last hit inspections of parts; communicate that the die is ready for the next set or need for repair to the Engineering Manager. Perform accurate reporting of production quantities into MRP (AX) system. 

QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION And/or EXPERIENCE

High school diploma or general education degree (GED) required.

Language Skills

Must have ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, production and quality recording, procedure manuals and manufacturing work instructions.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT 

Items described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Physical Demands:

The employee is regularly required to use fingers, handle, feel and reach; frequently required to

stand, walk, sit, bend, lift and talk or hear; occasionally required to climb, balance, stoop, kneel,

crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific

vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision and

depth perception.

Work Environment:

The employee is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts. The noise level is usually loud.

All proper PPE must be worn in all manufacturing areas and responsible for maintaining PPE

standards.

title: Radio Frequency Design Engineer
description:
Would you like to work on the next generation of Defense projects RF Design Engineer for Crane A&E? You’ll have the opportunity to work from concept through to completion (including on-site production) of complex integrated microwave solutions with career progression and advancement already planned for this role!
As an RF Design Engineer, you will play a crucial role in driving the future of Military / Defense equipment and applications by actively designing, enhancing, and analyzing RF and mixed-signal communications hardware components. This is an exciting opportunity to work at one of Crane A&E's flagship facilities, where you will be engaged in cutting-edge Military & Defense projects and be at the forefront of designing and developing state of-the-art Integrated Microwave Assemblies. You’ll be part of an innovative team pushing the boundaries of technology and working hand in hand with Prime OEMs.
RF Design Engineer Responsibilities• Collaborate on RF/Microwave/Millimeter communication hardware projects, from concept to completion.• Conducting end-to-end systems analysis and utilizing analytical tools, cascade analysis, or up/down converters to model and simulate the performance of circuits or complete systems.• Assist in the design and detailed analysis of RF and mixed-signal components across diverse frequency ranges.• Contribute to filter modeling, ensuring peak RF communication system performance.
RF Design Engineer Requirements• BS in Electrical Engineering, MS preferred.• Familiarity with microwave/millimeter-wave design principles.• Knowledge of RF and mixed-signal design technologies, encompassing receivers, synthesizers, and transmitters.• Experience or keen interest in semiconductor reference design is essential, which includes aspects like schematic diagrams, layout guidelines, BOM, and more.
Compensation: $90k to $225k+, negotiable - based on experience and qualifications, plus benefits and potential stock options for very senior positions.
Crane A&E is launching a significant recruitment drive to meet our growing customer demands. Interviews are scheduled within 2-3 business days of your application submission, based on your availability. We're seeking RF Design Engineers with RF skills ranging from Level I to Level V Don't hesitate to apply so we can discuss the role, and your aspirations, and determine if Crane A&E aligns with your career trajectory. Rest assured, all applications will receive a response within 1 working day.

title: Apartment Leasing Manager
description:
Job Description

BASIC PURPOSE:

Performs functions to manage and participate in the implementation of the marketing and business plan for one or more properties, tracks and reports on results against plan, manages leasing staff, leases properties, participates in lease renewal and recertification process, ensures file compliance, and provides resident services, working within the limits of established policy.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

 Responsible for all aspects of leasing and marketing to prospective residents.  Interviews, recommends hire and trains leasing staff. Schedules, assigns, and explains work. Monitors work quality and assists to resolve operating problems. Counsels and coaches employees, establishes standards of performance and appraises performance. Provides technical, managerial, and performance guidance. Interprets company rules and regulations, and clarifies policy, maintains discipline, handles employee grievances, and maintains harmonious employee relations.  Ensures that property is prepared for business, walks the property and makes adjustments or reports on elements that are unsightly or are in need of repair. Unlocks models and club house and check for cleanliness and welcoming environment. Ensures that collateral and signage are available to potential residents.  Greets prospective residents and determines for which program they will qualify based on number of persons in household and income levels. Shows models, amenities, and features, and communicates the benefits of residency, rent and deposit information.  Takes applications, initiates file, and ensures that all documentation is provided for certification process including birth certificates, employment, pay, and bank account verification. Expedites missing items as required. Ensures that applications and required documents are complete, verifies that information provided is consistent with validated data, and that all elements are prepared in compliance with policy, statutory, and tax credit requirements. Enters all required information into computer system. Issues documentation for approval by File Review Department and works with prospective residents to respond to inquiries and resolve related issues.  Coordinates with Maintenance to determine inventory that is available for move in and validate information in computer system with Community Director to verify availability of inventory. Assigns units based on inventory and qualifications and notifies potential residents of acceptance of application. Prints and executes leases and related documents. Collects rents, deposits and bonds as required. Inspects assigned units with resident at move in and document requirements for repair. Issues keys and amenity passes, and explains requirements, rules, and regulations to new residents.  Devises, implements, and participates in programs designed to promote assigned property in the community. Assesses comparable prices, specials, and amenities. Communicates with local employers, locators, other property managers, and residents, attends job fairs and other events to promote incentives and market the property. Recommends the implementation of creative marketing opportunities. 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS - continued:

 Tracks and reports on periodic progress against leasing plan and expenditures budget, explains variances, and recommends action to be taken to ensure that actual revenues and expenses are consistent with plan. Prepares, updates, and issues forecasts.  Provides resident services, responds to inquiries and enters work orders in computer system. Tracks and discharges completed work orders in computer system and files hard copy documentation. Responds to complaints from residents and works with staff and Community Director to ensure appropriate resolution and satisfaction.  Collects rent payments from residents. Ensures that amount paid is accurate. Issues late rent notices and contact residents personally to collect late rent payments. Hand delivers notices to residents regarding actions to be taken related to rules infractions or past due rents or fees.  Communicates with residents regarding renewal of leases and recertification of eligibility. Explains requirements, collects and validates documentation, and prepares forms to process and files renewals and recertifications in compliance with policy and statutory requirements.  Responds to resident complaints associated with community issues. Investigates, resolves, and follows up with residents to ensure satisfaction of concerns.  Assists to implement and execute resident activities including parties, orientations, training programs, and required resident service functions including job training, HOME seminars, health fairs, and financial counseling.  Files documentation including work orders, notifications, documents received for pending applications or certifications, and other items in defined files and locations. 

OTHER DUTIES MAY INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:

 Performs or assists with any duties or operations, as required to maintain workflow and to meet schedules and quality requirements.  Maintains safe work area and complies with safety procedures and equipment operating rules, keeping work area and store materials and supplies in a safe, clean, and orderly condition.  Participates in any variety of meetings and task force groups to integrate activities, communicate issues, obtain approvals, resolve problems, and maintain specified level of knowledge pertaining to new developments, requirements, and policies.  Ensures that work is carried out in compliance with all company policy and regulatory requirements. 

Pay for this position is commensurate with experience of candidate.

Company Description

ConcordRENTS is a distinguished leader in providing a quality and customer-centric property management experience with a focus on affordable and market rate multifamily communities throughout Florida. Our continued success is based upon our exceptional team members.

Join ConcordRENTS to advance your career while working for a company with over a 30-year history investing in maintaining our community and our team members while also enjoying industry-leading starting wages. title: Project Coordinator
description:
A new opportunity has become available for a Project Co-ordinator to join our busy Projects team based at our Houston facility.
As a Project Co-ordinator, the purpose of the role is to provide administrative support to project and service managers. This position plays a critical role within the organization to ensure the project workflow runs smoothly and efficiently.
As a Project Co-ordinator, you will be responsible for the following:
Track assigned project status from beginning to endMaintain logs of activities and completed workSupport service or project team by providing administrative support as requestedCommunicates project status with project/service managers and operations to support project timelinesEnters project contract data accurately into project tracking system, excel or other required softwareManage filing systems by recording information, updating paperwork, or maintaining documentsParticipates in project status meetingsCoordinate with internal supply chain at direction of project/service managers to ensure visibility on project status and timeline expectationsWorks collaboratively as part of a team that serves as backup to the project/service managers or other coordinators to ensure projects meet timelinesComplete internal audits, supports collection of contract documentation for project/service managers, reviews contract setup on Visual to ensure accuracy to signed projectAssists with phone calls or emails from customers, other departments, suppliers etc. to ensure information is being communicated to all that need to know regarding project statusSupport the standards, expectations, guidelines, and culture to achieve an incident and injury free operation in alignment with JDR’s Th!nk Safety principlesSupports and participates in the organization’s Continuous Improvement Program to conform to ISO 9001 requirements by complying with Quality policies and procedures and meeting Quality objectivesProvide support to ensure that each product is manufactured in accordance with customer, regulatory, and company requirementsPerform other duties as assigned
To be considered for this opportunity you will have a High School Diploma or equivalent and be confident and competent in the use of MS Office. You will possess strong time Management skills, be a self-starter with the ability to prioritize tasks, managing one’s own time and the time of others. In addition, you will have the ability to be self-directed, as well as working productively in groups. The post requires analytical thinking, by processing information and using logic to address work-related issues and problems.

title: Field Service Technician
description:
Overview

Alera Group is seeking an Field Service Technician to join our team.

Are you looking to be part of a company where you have exciting opportunities to learn, grow and make a positive impact?

Join a team where each employee is empowered to listen generously, speak straight, collaborate, and build each other up through mutual accountability and shared success.

If that is what you’re looking for, this is your chance to be part of an amazing organization!

Alera Group was created by the merging of high-performing, entrepreneurial firms across the country. Alera Group owns several registered investment advisers. Alera Group’s business model is motivated by the desire to find a better way to serve clients nationally without losing the independent thinking and values of our founding firms.

The Field Service Technician will be primarily responsible for onsite assistance in migrating acquired firms to Alera’s Enterprise IT standard. Candidates must be organized, energetic, have a strong customer service personality, love nationwide travel, and be well versed and experienced in Windows environments and networking.

Responsibilities

Travel nationally up to 75% of your time to new offices to install or swap out IT, VoIP & video conferencing equipment.Document and audit acquired firms’ technology estate.Troubleshoot basic network and IT Systems, including audio / video systems.Assist with onboarding of acquisitions by providing end-user and systems support.Work closely with other members of the implementation team on new acquisitions. Interface with vendors and partners to evaluate and implement onsite solutions including structured cabling and other IT systems.

Qualifications

Associate’s degree or higher, preferably in an IT, CS, or MIS field.Must be willing to travel nationwide as needed. Have a minimum of 3 years experience as a systems support technician. Experience with networking in a Windows environment, DNS, DHCP, DFS, and other related technologies.Understand audio/video components in a corporate environment, preferably Zoom Rooms.Extensive experience documenting technology environments.Have a reliable method of transportation.Ability to be on call and work off-hours, as needed.Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff.Demonstrated problem solving and customer service skills.Ability to lift 50+ lbs. of equipment.

Benefits

We offer comprehensive benefits to employees, including medical, dental, STD, LTD, life insurance, 401k, paid time off, and much more.

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

If you're a California resident, please read the California Consumer Privacy Act prior to applying.

title: Regional Head of Trademanagement AM
industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Job Title: Regional Head of Trademanagement AM

Job Location: Miami, Florida

The Regional Head of FCL & Trade Management is responsible for the overall volume development and GP of the trades in and out of the region. The individual drives and defines the trade strategies across the region aligned with global.

The regional head is responsible for setting and executing the global carrier strategy inside your region by personally managing and developing the relationships with our core carriers, and regional niche carriers (where needed) in the region.

Furthermore, the role is part of the global trade management leadership team responsible for aligning and setting a clear direction for the FCL product development and growth in collaboration with the growth and M&S organization.

Main Responsibilities


Strategy & PnL managementResponsible for FCL P&L and product development.Define and drive trade strategies and growth trade lanes.Ensure FCL budgeted business development in the assigned trades by setting and agreeing appropriate goals with carriers, countries, and partner regions.Ensure regular market information for all trade lanes & communicate them to Trade Management, OFR network and M&S. 


Carrier Management


Manage and develop relationships with carriers, focusing on Strategic Partner Carriers in the region and aligning with the global carrier strategy. Negotiate rates and other conditions like free times, credit terms etc. with carriers and conclude Service Contracts and Agreements in line with global strategy and according to corporate (legal) guidance.Centrally provides fundamental base (price, space, cooperation) for any FCL businesses on a regional and global level for all volumes from and to the region. Drive optimization of local charges across the regionMonitoring core carrier adherence performance weekly and monthly by utilizing various available tools to achieve target with carriers based on latest estimate. Lead, guide, strengthen and grow the regional trade management team and create next level leaders in individual trades. 


Allocation and Yield Management


Responsible (together with his team) for allocation management on his export trades, which includessetting up (weekly) allocations with all (core) carriersmaintaining agreed allocations in existing and future systemsmanaging supply (allocations) and demand (customer forecasted volumes and actual shipments/bookings)ensuring that agreed processes (related to allocation management) are followed by countriesResponsible for setting so-called “volume steering guidelines” which can vary per trade and countryMonitors actual volumes booked and shipped and takes corrective actions (= initiates carrier shifting) in orderto utilize available spaceto fulfill carrier targets and contract MQCsto optimize and maximize GP on customer, shipment, tradelane levelto optimize and maximize carrier incentives


Volume and Pricing


Responsible for the Port-to-Port pricing. Work with Growth Team to achieve joint approach for the organization across the network for SME growth and Large RFQs.Utilizing own market knowledge to obtain more details to win/ retain customers. Provide CSI and DGF BC/MNC/IBDM (Region and Country) guidance & consulting on OFR buying conditions (rates, space, equipment availability, free time etc.). Steer Focus Tradelanes in close cooperation with RDM (Route Development Manager) team and overseas TM. Assist in customer business implementation by enabling carrier’s cooperation and understanding. Actively engage with key customers for the region and sponsor the relationship growth with them. Drive, Support and/or co-ordinate global projects upon request. 


Reporting lines


Lead (directly or indirectly) multiple teams or individuals on equal or lower levels in a matrix setup to ensure policies and strategies are well aligned.The Regional Trade Heads and Trade Teams reports to the Regional Head of FCL & Trade Management.This role reports to the Regional Head of Ocean Freight and functionally to the Global Head of FCL & Trade Management.


Required Skills


Clear result orientation and commercial mindsetStrategic but action-oriented mindset which contributes to businessStrong commercial sense and motivation to serve the customerGood negotiator, always having the aspired goal in mindNeeds to be able to manage functional teams virtuallyExcellent networking abilities and impeccable interpersonal approachAble to lead larger internal and external meetingsFeels comfortable in a corporate environmentLikes to make decisions with significant impact to the networkReadiness to coach people and likes to work across culturesProven experience in Trade Management and Ocean Freight 


Other Requirements


Must be able to travel internationally ca. 20%Min. 8-10 years of experience in the OFR forwarding industryUsed to work in a multinational environment and in a large corporationSeasoned leader with successful track recordGood carrier contacts


Why join DHL Global Forwarding?

We are part of Deutsche Post DHL, the world’s leading logistics provider with operations in over 220 countries. Visit our career site on the web at https://www.logistics.dhl/us-en/home/careers.html

DHL GLOBAL FORWARDING HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED EXTERNALLY AS TOP EMPLOYER AND

 A GREAT PLACE TO WORK !

WHY DOES THIS MATTER TO YOU?


It means that when you partner with DHL Global Forwarding you’re working with an ethical and socially responsible company.We believe that when people love to come to work, they give more, try harder for their Customers, and are proud of the service they give.And that’s why external organizations have granted us different accolades for our people practices


Our Vision: The Logistics Company for the World

Our Mission: Excellence. Simply Delivered.

Our Purpose: We connect people, improving their lives.

Our Values: Respect & Results

Our Goals: Employer, Provider, and Investment of Choice, Living Responsibility

 

DHL Global Forwarding is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Work Authorization:

DHL Global Forwarding will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which visa sponsorship will be provided. Individuals who need sponsorship for work authorization, now or in the future, are not eligible for hire for this role.

About DHL Global Forwarding (DGF):

DHL Global Forwarding (DGF) is the world leader in air freight services and one of the leading providers of ocean freight services. Around 30,000 employees work to ensure the transport of all kinds of shipments by air or sea. DGF's logistics solutions span the entire supply chain, from the factory to the shop floor. They also include special transport-related services.

Our business model is very asset-light, as it is based on the brokerage of transport services between customers and freight carriers. We consolidate shipments to achieve higher volumes, purchase cargo space at better conditions and optimize network utilization. Our global presence means we can offer a variety of routing options and meet our customers' increasing demand for multimodal shipments.

title: Project Manager
description:
Job Description

Project Manager 

Dynamic, highly reputable, well-respected electrical contractor servicing commercial, industrial and residential clientele has an opportunity for you to contribute to the strategic operational development of the organization. We have experienced unprecedented growth as we continue to service our customers in the area. Our reputation is built on quality, personalized service, and attention to detail.

Reporting to the general manager, the project manager will oversee all projects, manage field employee manpower scheduling, order job all material and confirm job is at or under the estimated cost to perform work, while overseeing cohesive team of cross of cross-trained employees able to apply their skills to the necessary workload and properly address the needs of all customers.

Job Responsibilities:

Manage teams of foreman and determine the best staffing mix of labor for each job.

Confirm all projects are performed to meet the job goal while being on or below budget.

Visit job sites frequently to access, monitor and assist as necessary.

Communicate with the Estimator how the job was bid and associated details.

Plan with Sales the schedule of work for current and upcoming weeks.

Create and maintain two week forecast/tentative schedule of work to be performed and distribute to all foremen and the general manager.

Maintain flexibility to switch gears and reassign electricians as situations dictate.

Address field employee questions by asking them to answer/verify they are clear on all items to be done at the job and when each step must be completed.

Train foremen on best procedures and how to manage electricians.

Hold electricians accountable to complete the job properly and on time.

Prepare schedule of values and review contracts for new projects.

Manage good working relationship with G.C. project managers – resolve all issues.

Manage original submittals, submittal packages per specs., P.O.s, and Change Orders.

Confirm breakdowns for large change orders when different from original.

Maintain proper pricing for all Change Orders and have approved by G.C.

Create, manage, and address pricing changes for RFIs and ASIs.

Source, order, and schedule all rental eq., in-stock, and specialty items for jobs.

Review all vendor job invoices for accuracy and pricing.

Assist Shop Foreman to receive material and lighting packages.

Monitor tracking sheets for material and lighting packages.

Create/initiate draw requests, verify invoices from bills on project percent complete.

Contact inspector to schedule inspections.

Manage warranty items and track warranty dates.

Provide excel procurement logs for General Contractors as required.

Assist Shop Foreman with inventory and materials knowledge.

Communicate with Shop Foreman regarding Estimated Shipping Dates (ESDs).

Review and verify weekly company employee timesheets for accuracy.

Basic understanding of Project Plans and programs used by General Contractors.

Procore, Field wire, CIMC, Bluebeam, etc.

Maintain good working relationship with all company functional leaders and has working knowledge of both Finance and Sales.

Manage all disputes between employees and/or contractors.

Create a culture of trust, transparency, and continuous improvement by building effective communication channels with electricians.

Ask electricians to give their input and help develop processes of common sense.

Job Qualifications, physical Requirements and Character Traits:

Minimum of 8 years of related Electrical Contractor Industry experience.

Basic understanding of Project Plans and programs used by General Contractors.

Procore, Field wire, CIMC, Bluebeam, etc.

Team leader who works well with others, able to coach and delegate direction.

Can Do Attitude: Positive, Helpful and Energetic.

Strong Character with Enthusiasm and a Sense of Urgency.

Always Punctual, Ambitious, and most importantly Likeable.

Solid work history showing progressive reliability and conscientiousness.

Hearing and speaking to exchange information.

Dexterity of hands to perform the tasks required of the position.

Sight in order to be aware of hazards and dangers found in the nature of the work.

Ability to climb, stoop, kneel, reach, push, pull, grasp, and perform repetitive motions.

Lift moderate to heavy objects up to 60 lbs.

Working knowledge of Microsoft Office tools to communicate effectively with team and customers.

InsuraTec Services Group is a leading provider of financial planning and insurance services. We are currently seeking motivated individuals to join our team as Sales Representatives. This is a remote position that offers flexible hours and the opportunity for financial growth.

Account Management: Manage and maintain client accounts, ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction. description:

description:
Job Description

Join Our Team: Deputy Director of Construction Management Support Services

Rohadfox is on the lookout for a remarkable leader to fill the role of Deputy Director of Construction Management Support Services at the world’s busiest airports, Atlanta Hartsfield Jackson International Airport. This vital position is your chance to significantly impact the global transportation infrastructure.

Large Multi-million Dollar Construction Experience Required.

MUST HAVE A VAST CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT BACKGROUND AND KNOWLEDGE.

PAST MANAGERIAL EXPEREINCE OF A LARGE TEAM, A MUST.

 Competitive Compensation: Salary starting at $175,000 and up; depending on educational background and experience. Our salary package is designed to match the significance of this role within the industry.  Robust Benefits: We offer comprehensive health, dental, vision, retirement, relocation assistance, and leave benefits; ensuring your well-being and work-life balance.  Stability & Growth: Join us for a stable career path in an expanding organization, promising long-term job security.  Leadership Opportunity: Lead our construction management efforts, overseeing a talented team and managing impactful projects that elevate airport functionality and aesthetics.  Legacy & Impact: Leave a legacy in a crucial global infrastructure, with work that influences millions and sets new industry standards. 

Our Ideal Candidate: 

 Bachelor’s degree in architecture, Engineering, or Construction Management, with professional licensure or CMAA Certification preferred.  P.E. desired, but not required.  Minimum of 15 years of experience in managing large, multi-contract transportation programs.  Exceptional communication skills, with proficiency in client presentations and technical reporting and daily interfacing with stakeholders.  Demonstrated ability to negotiate and administer contracts, alongside a deep understanding of quality assurance and change management practices. 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Oversee the administrative operations of construction management tasks. Ensure the contractual obligations of the construction management staff and contractors are met to achieve client satisfaction. Coordinate the preparation of task orders, invoices, and monthly reports, ensuring projects stay on budget and schedule. Participate in client and project meetings, contractor negotiations, and the development of policies and procedures. Manage and supervise a large team to determine that the CM staff and contractor’s contractual obligations are met, client satisfaction is achieved, and that budget and schedule objectives are attained. Coordinates preparation of analysis, assessment and pricing of new assignments to determine that competent and credible proposals are submitted. Ø Responsible for evaluating the progress and quality of construction activities in conformance with approved schedules and budgets. 

WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

A visionary with deep experience in construction management, strategic planning, leadership, and communication skills. While a PE license is desired, it is not a requirement, emphasizing our focus on your expertise and ability to manage complex projects from start to finish.

If you're prepared for this rewarding challenge, we want to hear from you. This is more than a job; it’s your chance to make a mark in the aviation industry, enhance travel experiences worldwide, and build a legacy.

This is more than a job; it's a chance to play a crucial role in a project that will leave a lasting legacy. If you are ready to take on this challenge and make your mark in the construction management industry, we would love to hear from you. Apply today!

title: Industrial Maintenance Mechanic
description:
Job Description

Job Title: Industrial Maintenance Mechanic

Location: Lebec, CA

Company Overview:

Key Staffing is hiring for a company that is a leader in the manufacturing/production business. This position is in Lebec, CA. We are seeking a skilled and experienced Industrial Maintenance Mechanic to join the dynamic maintenance team. As a key player in the maintenance department, you will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of the industrial equipment and machinery, minimizing downtime, and contributing to the overall efficiency of the facility.

Responsibilities: 

 Perform routine maintenance tasks on industrial machinery, including but not limited to troubleshooting, repairing, and overhauling.  Conduct preventative maintenance to ensure equipment longevity and reliability.  Diagnose and repair mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and pneumatic issues promptly.  Collaborate with other maintenance team members to address complex technical problems and implement effective solutions.  Read and interpret equipment manuals, blueprints, and schematics to perform accurate repairs and installations.  Utilize computerized maintenance management systems (CMMS) to log work orders, track equipment history, and manage spare parts inventory.  Adhere to safety protocols and guidelines while performing maintenance activities to ensure a safe working environment.  Assist in the installation and commissioning of new equipment.  Train and mentor junior maintenance staff as needed.  Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance overall equipment efficiency. 

Requirements: 

 High school diploma or equivalent; technical degree or certification in industrial maintenance is preferred.  Proven experience as an Industrial Maintenance Mechanic in a manufacturing or industrial setting.  Strong mechanical aptitude with expertise in troubleshooting and repairing industrial equipment.  Proficiency in reading and interpreting technical manuals, blueprints, and schematics.  Familiarity with computerized maintenance management systems (CMMS).  Knowledge of safety regulations and practices in an industrial setting.  Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  Availability to work flexible hours and respond to emergency maintenance situations.  Physical stamina and dexterity to perform tasks that may require lifting, climbing, and working in confined spaces. 

If you possess the required skills and experience, we invite you to join our team and contribute to the success of the company. Apply now for this exciting opportunity!

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We participate in E-Verify.

title: Tactical Communications Subject Matter Expert
description:
Job Description

Tactical Communications Subject Matter Expert

Personnel Must Have:

A current SECRET security clearance at the time proposal is submitted and include supporting documents with the proposal.

A minimum of 10 years’ cumulative, current operational experience in signal support/communication systems and terminal devices to include radio, wire, and Battlefield Automated Systems (may include Guard and Reserve experience). (Current operational experience is defined as service ending within the last five years).

A bachelor’s degree in any discipline.

A minimum of six years’ specialized experience, defined as: Worked/practiced in the Army as a Signal Support Systems Specialist (25U or sister service equivalent) (concurrent with the 10 years’ operational experience in signal support).

A knowledge and a minimum of six years of experience in integrating currently fielded Signal Systems and Networks, installation, operation of radios and data distribution systems, handheld electronic equipment and satellite radio communications equipment to include, but not limited to AN/PRC-155, AN/PRC-117G, AN/VRC-92F, RT-1523, and WIN-T (concurrent with the 10 years’ operational experience in signal support).

A minimum of two years’ experience in conducting meetings, leading discussion groups, briefing senior audiences, effectively communicating conceptual ideas in writing, and orally articulating thoughts to support the development of Army and Fires concepts, doctrine and tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) IAW Army Regulation (AR) 25-50, “Preparing and Managing Correspondence” (17 May 2013) and Field Manual (FM) 6-0, C2, “Commander and Staff Organization and Operations” (22 April 2016).

A minimum of two years’ experience in the basic Adobe Acrobat and Microsoft office suite of applications (Word, Excel and PowerPoint).

Personnel will:

Evaluate the design performance capabilities of emerging organizations, Field Artillery and Air Defense Artillery (hereafter referred to as Fires) systems and associated Command and Control software and hardware applications (hereafter referred to as systems/capabilities), considering all Doctrine, Organization, Training Materiel, Leader Development, Personnel, Facilities (DOTML-PF) domains to assess mitigation of current and future capability gaps in the development of requirements and in review of proposed materiel solutions.

Conduct meetings and lead discussion groups.

Review, analyze, and evaluate systems/capabilities, regarding program compliance with current requirements, acquisition regulations and policies; provide subject matter expertise to systems related integrated product team venues, design reviews, basis of issue evaluation and management, and test events; and ensure that information is prepared for inclusion in relevant Fires manuals and doctrine.

Review, evaluate and analyze resource programming and project management schedules developed by Program Executive Officer and Program Manager (PEO/PM) in order to adequately prepare TRADOC positions; develop and present briefings to senior leaders, as required, prepare fact sheets, talking papers, decision papers and information papers in support of systems/capabilities; develop/update new system/capability tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs).

Develop a monthly status report/ significant activity reports and EXSUMs of key events to TCM Fires Cells. The status report shall include the status of ongoing system production lines, system fielding’s, testing, system modifications / improvements, input from institutional and operational units, critical maintenance issues, and calendar of key future activities.

Travel to support the accomplishment of duties and responsibilities, (25% TDY).

Prepare written reports of analysis and assessments, and prepares and presents briefings to senior leaders.

Capture/document user required capabilities and gaps for CNAs, ICDs, CDDs, CPDs and other required JCIDS documents.

Develop briefings, prepare fact sheets, talking papers, decision papers and information paper in support of systems/capabilities; develop/update new system/capability TTPs.

Develop a monthly status report, prepare and submit significant activity reports and EXSUMs of key events to TCM Fires Cells. Each document submitted shall contain as a minimum: purpose, place, dates, participants, decisions, and taskings.

title: General Engineer
description:
Title: General Engineer, GS-0801-07/09, (Recent Graduate) Job Vacancy link: https://www.usajobs.gov/GetJob/ViewDetails/784633900 
This opportunity opened today, April 9th, 2024, and will close at midnight on April 22nd, 2024, OR when we have received 150 applications which may be sooner than the closing date. 
DutiesApplies engineering knowledge to conventional engineering specific situations and participates in projects.Assists higher grade scientists and engineers in engineering work.Reviews tobacco products to determine the adequacy of the results from engineering disciplines.Searches and reviews engineering literature to advance knowledge, participates in meetings, and participates in research projects conducted by senior engineers.Supports higher-graded engineers/ scientists in their verbal and written conclusions to other Federal agencies, industry, universities, and state, local, and foreign governments.Participates in the development of portions of new and amended regulations, policies, and procedures.
QualificationsApplicants must meet the following eligibility requirements to participate in this Recent Graduate Program:
A. Completed all requirements for an associates, bachelors, masters, professional, doctorate, vocational, or technical degree or qualifying certificate from an accredited educational institution within the 2 years preceding the closing date of this announcement. -OR-B. Released or discharged from active duty within the previous two years by 04/22/2024, where as a veteran who, due to a military service obligation, was precluded from applying to the Recent Graduate Program during any portion of the 2-year eligibility period following completion of degree or certificate requirements, are entitled to a full 2-year period of eligibility upon release or discharge from active duty. In no event, however, may the eligibility period extend beyond 6 years from the date on which the preference eligible veteran completed the requirements of the degree or certificate. -OR-C. Individuals who are expected to graduate with a qualifying Associate's, Bachelor's, Master's, Doctorate, professional, vocational or technical degree or certificate program by 06/30/2024. Current students must meet all eligibility and qualification requirements before a final offer can be made.
NOTE: You must submit transcripts or official documentation to verify your eligibility under the Recent Graduate Program. Transcripts MUST reflect the degree/certificate program and the degree conferred date. If your degree/certificate has not been conferred, you must provide proof of the anticipated graduation date. Selectee's entry on duty date will be upon degree conferment.
In addition to the eligibility requirements for the Pathways Recent Graduate Program, you must also meet the following Individual Occupational Requirements by 04/22/2024 in order to qualify for the General Engineer, 0801 positions.
A. Degree: Engineering. To be acceptable, the program must: (1) lead to a bachelor's degree in a school of engineering with at least one program accredited by ABET; or (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics.-OR-B. Combination of education and experience -- college-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical and mathematical sciences underlying engineering, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering. The adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by one of the following:1. Professional registration or licensure -- Current registration as an Engineer Intern (EI), Engineer in Training (EIT)1, or licensure as a Professional Engineer (PE) by any State, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico. Absent other means of qualifying under this standard, those applicants who achieved such registration by means other than written test (e.g., State grandfather or eminence provisions) are eligible only for positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of their registration. For example, an applicant who attains registration through a State Board's eminence provision as a manufacturing engineer typically would be rated eligible only for manufacturing engineering positions.2. Written Test -- Evidence of having successfully passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE)2 examination or any other written test required for professional registration by an engineering licensure board in the various States, the District of Columbia, Guam, and Puerto Rico.3. Specified academic courses -- Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences and that included the courses specified in the basic requirements under paragraph A. The courses must be fully acceptable toward meeting the requirements of an engineering program as described in paragraph A.4. Related curriculum -- Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in an appropriate scientific field, e.g., engineering technology, physics, chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology, may be accepted in lieu of a bachelor's degree in engineering, provided the applicant has had at least 1 year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily there should be either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions. (The above examples of related curricula are not all-inclusive.)
In addition to meeting the Individual Occupational Requirements above, you must also meet the OPM Qualification Requirements listed below by 04/22/2024 in order to qualify for the General Engineer, 0801, at GS - 7/9.
For GS-7:
A. Applicants must have at least one full year of specialized experience, equivalent to at least the GS-05 level in the Federal service which includes interpreting or reviewing scientific data. -OR-B. Completion of one year of graduate level education related to the position being filled (Engineer) from an accredited college and/or university. -OR-C. A bachelor's degree as described in the Basic Qualification Requirements above AND meet Superior Academic Achievement provision (S.A.A.) criteria (visit the site for more detail information). S.A.A. is based on (1) class standing, (2) grade-point average, or (3) honor society membership. -OR-D. Have a combination of experience as described in "A" above and education as described in "B" above, that when combined equals 100% of the total requirements. -OR-E. Have an engineering bachelor's degree AND have appropriate specialized experience as an Engineering Technician; -OR-F. Have successfully completed a 5-year program of study of at least 160 semester hours leading to a bachelor's degree in engineering.
For GS-9:A. Applicants must have at least one full year of specialized experience, equivalent to the GS-07 grade level in the Federal service which includes preparing scientific progress reports, presentations or conducting analysis. -OR-B. Have 2 years of years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to a master's degree in Engineering or master's or equivalent graduate degree; -OR-C. Have a combination of superior academic achievement AND one (1) year of appropriate specialized Engineering experience; -OR-D. Have successfully completed a 5-year program of study of at least 160 semester hours leading to a bachelor's degree in engineering AND have one (1) year of appropriate professional Engineering experience.

title: Construction Manager-Mobile Home Demolition & Replacement
description:
Job Description

As a Construction Manager for mobile home demolition and replacement projects, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the construction process, from demolition of existing mobile homes to the completion of new construction. You will work closely with clients, contractors, subcontractors, and other stakeholders to ensure that projects are completed safely, on time, and within budget. You will be responsible for managing the entire construction process, including planning, organizing, directing, and controlling all activities related to the demolition and replacement of mobile homes.

Responsibilities:

Project Planning: Develop and implement project plans, including determining the scope of work, creating a construction timeline, and establishing project budgets. Contractor Management: Select and manage contractors and subcontractors, including soliciting bids, negotiating contracts, and overseeing their work to ensure compliance with project plans and specifications. Budget Management: Monitor and manage project budgets, including tracking expenses, reviewing invoices, and adjusting as needed to ensure that projects are completed within budget. Construction Supervision: Supervise all construction activities, including demolition of existing mobile homes, site preparation, foundation installation, and installation of new mobile homes, ensuring compliance with local building codes, safety regulations, and project specifications. Quality Control: Maintain quality control procedures to ensure that workmanship, materials, and construction processes meet or exceed established standards. Schedule Management: Develop and maintain construction schedules, including coordinating and sequencing construction activities to ensure that projects are completed on time. Communication: Provide regular construction related project updates to clients, stakeholders, and team members, and effectively communicate any changes or issues that may impact the project timeline or budget. Problem Solving: Identify and resolve any issues or challenges that may arise during construction, including unexpected delays, design changes, and material shortages. Safety Management: Ensure that all construction activities are carried out in compliance with safety regulations and best practices and take appropriate action to address any safety concerns or incidents. Documentation: Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation, including drawings, QC inspections, contracts, change orders, and other project-related records. 

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in construction management, civil engineering, or related field (or equivalent work experience). Proven experience as a Construction Manager, preferably with experience in mobile home demolition and replacement projects. Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and building codes. Excellent project management skills, including budgeting, scheduling, and resource allocation. Ability to read and interpret construction plans, specifications, and other project documents. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with clients, contractors, and team members. Familiarity with relevant laws, regulations, and permitting processes related to construction projects. Ability to work independently, solve problems, and make decisions in a fast-paced construction environment. Proficiency in using construction management software and other relevant software tools. Valid driver's license and reliable transportation

Company Description

Timberline Construction Group is a growing, dynamic, Alabama based business that provides services both within and outside the United States. We specialize in Civil Construction, Disaster Response Services, Commercial Construction, Residential Construction, and Affordable Community Housing Services. Widely acknowledged for our integrity and ability to complete complex projects, Timberline Construction Group is the company of choice for Federal and State Agencies and private clients.

Timberline has worked with FEMA, state agencies, international governments, the United Nations, IA-TAC III contractors, 8(a)’s, USACE, National Parks Service, United Way, and countless private entities to execute diverse types of construction projects.

We specialize in Civil Construction, Disaster Response Services, Commercial Construction, Residential Construction, and Affordable Community Housing Services. Widely acknowledged for our integrity and ability to complete complex projects, Timberline Construction Group is the company of choice for Federal and State Agencies and private clients. Timberline has worked with FEMA, state agencies, international governments, the United Nations, IA-TAC III contractors, 8(a)’s, USACE, National Parks Service, United Way, and countless private entities to execute diverse types of construction projects.

title: CDL Driver - Local, Home Every Night! (Alpharetta, GA)
description:
Job Description

Job Title: CDL Driver, CDL-A (Alpharetta, GA)

Local - Home Every Night!* **Must live within a commutable distance to Alpharetta, GA**

Reports To: Fleet Manager

This job description describes the minimum job requirements. This description is illustrative and does not imply the functions outlined below are the exclusive standards of this position. Incumbents will be expected to follow additional instructions and perform other related duties as required.

Purpose of the Position/Job Summary:

The Class A CDL Truck Driver will be responsible for operating vehicles and equipment, transporting company inventory, inspecting and adjusting loads on trucks, loading and unloading all equipment, materials, tools, etc., and maintaining accurate reports and documentation. The ideal candidate will be able to effectively communicate with other drivers, superintendents, and vendors to schedule and execute the tasks efficiently and safely. Hours per day may vary but occasional extended hours and weekend hours may be necessary. This position requires a CDL Class A Driver’s License.

Essential Functions:

While operating all vehicles and equipment drivers must abide by all the safety policies and state / local traffic laws. Driver will work with other drivers and coordinators pick-up and drop-off locations, material, equipment and implements daily. Use route navigation apps and knowledge of Atlanta area. Daily Pre/Post Trip Inspections of every vehicle they are required to operate. Drive in inclement weather, such as rain. Notifying company mechanics of major equipment repairs. Repairing minor equipment problems. Maintaining organized, clean and safe vehicles and environment. Manage routes and routines so they proceed in the most efficient way possible. Find ways to conserve resources, including fuel to benefit the business. Comply with all DOT and in-house regulations and rules. 

Job Specification (Knowledge, skills, and abilities typically required for competent performance in the job):

Understanding of DOT requirements for Truck Drivers, and be able to demonstrate skills. Strong Communication SkillsTeam-building QualitiesDesire for Ongoing Training – web-based, or hands-onReliable, Disciplined, flexible, dependable. Detail oriented, work responsibly under minimal supervisionAbility to operate various vehicles with or without trailers. Ability to operate various lawn care machinery. 

Supervisory Responsibility: 

This job has no supervisory responsibility.

Minimum Qualifications:

Valid Class A CDL (we will help you get tanker endorsement)High School diploma / GED required. Must be at least 21 years old. No serious tickets or accidents in last 5 yearsNo DWI / DUI in last 10 yearsMust have the physical ability to climb in and out of all types of vehicles and equipment, multiple times per day. Must be physically capable of performing all duties related to the position, physical activities, such as, but not limited to, lifting heavy items (up to 50 lbs. unassisted), bending, standing, stooping, sitting, climbing low to high heights, jogging, and walking, all multiple times per day. Licenses/Certifications:

Valid Class A CDL Tanker Endorsement - or we will help you get one

Must be authorized to work in the United States.

Candidates may be asked to pass a drug test, and/or background check, depending on location and approval of driving privileges.

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
description:
Do you enjoy the thrill of the hunt? Winning every day, scoring goal after goal, picking up the phone and speaking with new people every day to open new doors? Have you been told that you are tenacious and persuasive?
About Brooks International:Brooks International, recently awarded Consulting Magazine’s Best Firms to Work For 2022, is seeking individuals with a proven track record of success as a lead generator to join our award-winning, Global Professional Services Firm. Founded in 1960, we are intimately known by Private Equity, Global 2000 CEOs and Privately Held Chairs as a unique Executive Services company and remain unmatched in the marketplace. As a profit-motivated firm that serves the direct and focused interest of the client CEO, we specifically deliver to our client’s strategic imperatives, singularly delivering rapidly executed business and financial possibilities. Moreover, our approach integrates both tactical and behavioral step change upgrades. All business benefits generated incorporate organizational considerations, which are behaviorally sustainable and deliver accelerated and extraordinary short and long term profit value.
Position Overview: Business Development Associates are responsible for utilizing Brooks’ expertly defined lead generation methodology to target, initiate and develop relationships with qualified new prospects and together with a dedicated Managing Partner, generate revenue for the firm. Business Development Associates first research and analyze the current economic landscape of their assigned territory, then interface directly with top tier CEO prospects by making contact and setting a meeting (through a direct phone conversation) to introduce them to a Managing Partner and Brooks International. The Business Development Associate will perform in-depth pre-meeting research on behalf of the Managing Partner and preemptively assemble a perspective on the prospect’s impactable business situation. Together, the Business Development Associate and Managing Partner create a highly intelligent, focused, fact-based strategy (utilizing Brooks International’s established methodology) to convert each prospect to a client. Associates are tied directly to organizational revenue and drive new business opportunities in a variety of different industries, including Manufacturing, Private Equity, Oil & Gas, Energy, Aerospace, Accommodation, and many more. This position leverages the firm’s decades of experience as a premier professional services provider.
Career Path and Compensation:Successful performance at the Business Development Associate level will lead to several accelerated opportunities and avenues along the career path in both Business Development and Management Consulting, with both paths leading to Managing Partner. The expected compensation is as follows:Year 1-2: $150,000 - $250,000Year 3-4: $250,000 - $325,000Year 5+: $500,000 - Unlimited
In This Role You Will:Generate leads and work in tandem with a Managing Partner, and as a team, be assigned a pre-existing, multi-state territory and database, moving prospective clients through the business development cycle and creating a client experience that is consistent with the firm’s Methodology.Deeply embed yourself in understanding and monitoring the economic landscape of your assigned territory, becoming an industry-agnostic expert in the current business happenings of your assigned territory.Conduct in-depth research and develop and execute strategy tailored to each prospect, for the purpose of converting a prospect to a client.Be involved in each phase of a client transformation, supporting due-diligence analytics and navigating account expansion opportunities.Develop a critical and ongoing understanding of corporate structures, company ownership types, decision making authority, and market trends.Maintain the data integrity of your territory to ensure the CRM database is accurate and contains up-to-date company information (i.e. ownership, industry, revenue, geography, P&L responsibility, corporate address, etc.)Maintain the daily call schedule and meet routine statistic requirements.
The Right Candidate Possesses:Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree1-3 years success in inside sales as a lead generator utilizing a strategic outbound calling approachThe following personal attributes: intellectual curiosity, a passion for business, a positive attitude and belief in what’s possible, strong desire for and appreciation for feedback, maturity beyond his/her years, unwavering self-discipline and commitment to mission and the desire to serve executives at the highest order, both internally to Brooks International and externally to our clientsThe ability and commitment to: maintain professionalism at all times, work under pressure while achieving the highest level of quality, seek direction and improve all skills required for the role and career growth (communication skills, presentation skills, analytical capability etc.)
Recruitment Process and Relocation Assistance:Please apply for this role through LinkedIn if you would like an opportunity to be invited to an upcoming live virtual recruitment event. These events have limited capacity to ensure that all attendees have an opportunity to a live Q&A with the CEO and an interview with a Brooks International team member. These events are designed as the first step in the Talent Acquisition process. The Business Development group works on-site in West Palm Beach, FL office. We are within a 10 minute walking distance of the Brightline station.
The position above offers a lucrative compensation package consisting of a competitive base salary and a comprehensive benefit package, including employer funded health, vision and dental benefits, life insurance, short and long term disability, 401(k) savings plan and paid time off.

title: Field Sales and Marketing Representative
description: FIELD SALES AND MARKETING REPRESENTATIVE – Techtronic Industries, NA (TTI)About Us:TTI (Techtronic Industries) is a fast-paced, high energy, organization that rewards out-of-the-box thinking to foster innovation allowing us to be the best in our industry. We provide a multi-faceted training program and hands-on field experience that will stimulate, challenge, and reward you.TTI is a world-class leader in design, manufacturing and marketing of power tools and accessories, outdoor product equipment, and floor care products. Our consumers range from professional and industrial users in the home improvement, repair, and construction industries to homeowners & DIY enthusiasts. Our unrelenting strategic focus on powerful brands, innovative products, operational excellence, and exceptional people drives our culture.
